name: Alternative Content
description: Provide text alternatives for non-text content to aid assistive technologies. This includes elements like images, videos, and audio.

name: Time-based Media (Videos, Audio)
description: Provide control over time-based media, such as videos and audio. Make media perceivable using different senses.
additionalRequirements: provide alternatives (e.g. text, sign language)
offer captions
allow to control volume, pause, stop, navigate, and adjust speed
do not play background audio or allow to stop it

name: Synthesized Speech Output
description: Allow users to control synthesized speech output, such as volume, rate and pitch.

name: Adaptable Views
description: Allow displaying content in different ways (for example simpler layout) without losing information or structure.
additionalRequirements: allow programmatically determined content structure
allow programmatical understanding of elements
enable use of content with different screen sizes and resolutions

name: Contrast and Color
description: Consider visibility of content as well as cultural and situational differences.
additionalRequirements: do not convey information with color alone
provide sufficient contrast between text and background
if possible use system colors and styles
allow to invert colors
use easy to perceive colors
consider cultural aspects (e.g. red as warning or positive color)

name: Personalization
description: Enable the user to personalize the appearance and behavior of the app.
additionalRequirements: enable text resizing, line height, color and formatting changes
allow customization highlighting and focus
allow to turn on accessibility features (e.g. voice control)
store settings persistently
allow multiple settings profiles

name: Text
description: Allow text to be readable in different sizes and conditions.
additionalRequirements: allow text to resize and reflow
allow font size changes
ensure proper font weight and style
avoid long texts using italic text, full justification or similar
prevent using images of text and use real text instead

name: Content on Hover or Focus, and Modals
description: Consider the use of hover and focus events, as well as modals.
additionalRequirements: ensure easy dismissal of content
prevent content disappearing while hovering or focusing on it
do not create an app within an app experience with modals

name: Keyboard Usability
description: Allow the user to interact with the app fully using a keyboard.
additionalRequirements: prevent keyboard traps (e.g. situations without a way to leave)
allow using and disabling (custom) keyboard shortcuts
ensure proper focus management
follow keyboard navigation conventions

name: Touch Gestures
description: Allow a consistent and easy interaction with the app using touch gestures.
additionalRequirements: do not override system gestures
use simple and consistent gestures
offer alternatives for gesture controls
allow assistive technology to simulate gestures

name: Virtual Keyboard
description: Ensure the app is usable with a virtual keyboard. This inclused the use of correct keyboard types (e.g. numeric, email).

name: Timed Interactions
description: Provide the user with enough time to interact with the app.
additionalRequirements: allow to disable, adjust or extend time limits
prevent time limits for critical actions
do not require timing for essential features

name: Interruptions
description: Interruptions should be kept to a minimum and be easy to dismiss or postpone.

name: App Onboarding
description: Provide a smooth and accessible onboarding experience for new users. This includes clear instructions and explanations.

name: Motion
description: Consider the impact of motion (e.g. animations) on users.
additionalRequirements: allow at most 3 flashes per second to prevent seizures and physical reactions
do not use motion that is essential for interaction
allow to disable, pause or reduce motion

name: Navigation
description: Allow the user to navigate, find content and determine their location within the app.
additionalRequirements: use structured navigation elements (e.g. headings, lists)
order components logically and consistently
allow programmatically determining navigation structure
inform assistive technologies about content or layout changes
show events related to external apps or web content opening

name: Element Interaction
description: Allow direct interaction with elements, such as buttons, links, and form fields using different input methods.

name: User Orientation
description: Support the user in understanding the app's layout and structure.
additionalRequirements: display distinctive selection, focus, and change of state
allow user to highlight or magnify content
make the focus programmatically determinable
keep the focus within the viewport
avoid nested scrolling areas

name: Input Devices and Modalities
description: Allow the user to use different input devices and modalities, such as keyboards, touch pens, and game controllers.
additionalRequirements: allow ambidextrous use
offer consistent interaction behavior
prevent accidental actions (e.g. motion actuation)
do not prevent platform-specific input methods

name: Click Targets (Buttons, Links, etc.)
description: Ensure that clickable elements are sized and spaced appropriately. Ensure that they are classified as clickable for assistive technology.

name: Predictable Behavior
description: Ensure that the app behaves in a predictable way, especially when it comes to user interface elements.
additionalRequirements: prevent unexpected changes of focus
allow setting changes to apply predictably
use understandable navigation
consistent identification of elements with same function

name: User Help
description: Offer accessible help to users. Ensure that it is easy to find and provide relevant and consistentent language and images

name: Input Assistance
description: Make it easy for users to provide information and interact with the app.
additionalRequirements: validate input
show errors
automatically repair input if possible
offer autocomplete and suggestions
explain expected input format
allow different input methods (e.g. voice, keyboard, touch)
offer reset, undo, and redo options
consider using confirmation dialogs for destructive actions

name: Authentication and Session Management
description: Create an understandable and accessible authentication and session management process.
additionalRequirements: prevent overuse of authentication tests (e.g. CAPTCHA, password entry)
warn user about session timeouts
prevent data loss on re-authentication

name: Platform Compatibility
description: Ensure the compatibility of the app with different platforms and devices. This includes different operating systems, browsers, and assistive technologies.

name: Meet Known Conventions
description: Follow relevant accessibility conventions and standards for your app and its context.

name: Status Indicators
description: Use indicators to inform the user about current conditions, such as loading, progress, and errors.
additionalRequirements: make feedback available to all users (e.g. not only visual)
show action progress (as accurate as possible)
show failure and success states
ensure readibility of status indicators using assistive technology

name: Text Formatting
description: Ensure that text formatting options are available to all users (e.g. assistive technology users).

name: Text Search
description: Provide the option to search for text within the app.
additionalRequirements: offer suggestions
show (if) results found
allow to navigate to search results
allow to clear search

name: Alternative Views
description: Present the app in different ways, such as simplified or complex views.
additionalRequirements: allow to switch between views
allow to customize views
allow to navigate between views
offer outline navigation by structure (e.g. using sidebar)

name: Documentation
description: Document all features and functionalities of the app. Put a special focus on accessibility features and promote the documentation's existence to users.

name: Automatically Specified Content
description: Make automatically generated content accessible (e.g. templates, auto generated text).

name: Restructuring Content
description: Influencing the structure of the content (e.g. copying, moving) should not affect its accessibility.

name: Production of Accessible Content
description: Support users by providing accessible content production tools and features (e.g. writing captions, alternative text, and descriptions).

name: Guide the Production of Accessible Content
description: Offer the same visibility and guidance for accessible content production as for other content production. If content is not going to be accessible, require user confirmation.

name: Accessibility Checking
description: Automatically check user created content for accessibility issues. Offer guidance on how to fix issues.

name: Customizable Graphical Controls
description: Allow the visual appearance of graphical controls to be customized. Allow to move and resize controls to cooperate with assistive technology controls.

name: Accessibility Tools
description: Support the use of accessibility tools, such as screen readers, magnifiers, and voice control.
additionalRequirements: make the app programmatically determinable
make the app fully operable using assistive technology
provide accessible alternatives to features that are not accessible
consider platform-specific accessibility features

name: User Error Reporting
description: Allow users to easily report errors and issues. Provide guidance on how to report issues.

name: Lighting Conditions
description: Test the app under different lighting conditions to ensure readability and usability.

name: Internationalization
description: Offer the app in different languages. Consider reading direction and other language-specific requirements.

name: Drag and Drop
description: Offer alternative ways to perform drag and drop actions. Ensure that drag and drop actions are accessible to all users.

name: Fullscreen Mode
description: Allow exiting fullscreen mode easily. Allow to see or reveal important controls (e.g. video controls) in fullscreen mode.

name: Haptics
description: Support haptic feedback for users who rely on it. Use system defaults for consistency.

name: Language and Wording
description: Put special focus on the language and wording used in the app.
additionalRequirements: use understandable and consistent language
avoid jargon and abbreviations
explain relevant terms and concepts
avoid using language that is offensive or discriminatory
use inclusive language
clearly describe actions and consequences

name: Data Visualization (Charts, Tables, etc.)
description: Make the data state of visualizations programmatically determinable. Ensure that the data is accessible to all users and understandable.

name: Picker Menus
description: Create logically structured and accessible picker menus. Consider picker range and granularity.

name: Action Menus
description: Offer quick actions and context menus to the user.
additionalRequirements: display most used actions based on current context
allow to customize actions
prevent showing irrelevant or too many actions
depict actions using clear text and icons

name: Styling and Appearance
description: Create a consistent style by using visual hierarchy, color, typography, and more. Keep the interface simple and understandable.

name: Augmented Reality
description: Ensure the functionality of AR features in different environments (e.g. lighting conditions, space). Consider the impact of motion, sound and haptics. Ensure the user's safety

name: Machine Learning
description: Ensure that machine learning models are trained on diverse data and are tested for fairness and accuracy. Provide explanations for the model's decisions.

name: Network Conditions
description: Ensure the implementation of the app is robust and reliable under different network conditions. Provide feedback to the user about the network status.

sources.custom: This is a custom examplary requirement.

name: Battery Consumption
description: Ensure the app does not consume too much battery. Provide feedback to the user about the battery status. Consider colors, efficiency, and performance.

sources.custom: This is a custom examplary requirement.
